thread.title: How Guardian readers are coping with the courgette crisis
thread.title_full: How Guardian readers are coping with the courgette crisis

author: James Walsh and Guardian readers
title: How Guardian readers are coping with the courgette crisis
text:
How Guardian readers are coping with the courgette crisis 
Our share their coping tips and pictures of the lesser-spotted vegetable There are courgettes in Yorkshire. Photograph: James Murgatroyd/GuardianWitness Thursday 19 January 2017 15.52 GMT Last modified on Thursday 19 January 2017 15.54 GMT View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close What a pickle: UK gripped by courgette shortage Read more 
“It’s taken me three days and three trips to three different Sainsbury’s to track down the courgettes essential to the success of tonight’s pasta bake,” said Charlotte Owen in Nottingham. 
“It could have ended in disaster and another take away, thus ruining January’s healthy eating regime,” she added. 
James Murgatroyd reports limited courgette availability in Bramley, Yorkshire. 
These three beauties were the last on the shelf in Morrisons in Bramley on the outskirts of Leeds. Dealer cost c.£1.50. Street value, up to £4,500*. 
*Actual value may be lower than estimate shown.
